item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 15, 2025 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Sweden is investing €104M to bring back printed textbooks (147 points | 105 comments)
2. Google brings real-time information from The Associated Press to Gemini (44 points | 21 comments)
3. UnitedHealth overcharged cancer patients for drugs by over 1,000% (145 points | 67 comments)
4. Ropey – A UTF8 text rope for manipulating and editing large texts. in Rust (141 points | 58 comments)
5. Why does Cloudflare Pages have such a generous free tier? (241 points | 150 comments)
6. Empirical Health is hiring interns to build data-driven primary care ( | hide)
7. A Marriage Proposal Spoken in Office Jargon (264 points | 129 comments)
8. Why the weak nuclear force is short range (261 points | 107 comments)
9. Lambda Calculus in 383 Bytes (2022) (185 points | 30 comments)
10. Show HN: I made a tool to save multimedia from various platforms (10 points | 9 comments)
11. Modern JavaScript for Django Developers (112 points | 72 comments)
12. GOG Joins European Federation of Game Archives, Museums & Preservation Projects (149 points | 13 comments)
13. Scheduled Tasks in ChatGPT (30 points | 5 comments)
14. Gemini Advanced now included in Google Workspace (11 points | 11 comments)
15. Imaging mounted disk volumes under duress (2021) (32 points | 2 comments)
16. Code Reviews: A Success Story (6 points | 2 comments)
17. Natrium 'advanced nuclear' power plant wins Wyoming permit (23 points | 9 comments)
18. Sky-scanning complete for Gaia (109 points | 30 comments)
19. Show HN: I Built a Fair Alternative to Product Hunt for Indie Makers Like You (37 points | 13 comments)
20. KEON is a human-readable serde format that syntactic similar to Rust (27 points | 15 comments)
21. Qantas South Africa flights delayed by falling debris from SpaceX rockets (93 points | 80 comments)
22. Arnold's Cat (2018) (16 points | 3 comments)
23. (Right-Nulled) Generalised LR Parsing (39 points | 1 comment)
24. Train faster Static Embedding Models with Sentence Transformers (16 points | discuss)
25. Take the pedals off the bike (360 points | 384 comments)
26. Personalized voice recordings by Elwood "You've got mail!" Edwards (83 points | 23 comments)
27. TSMC begins producing 4-nanometer chips in Arizona (311 points | 280 comments)
28. Home Loss File System (353 points | 93 comments)
29. Generate audiobooks from E-books with Kokoro-82M (357 points | 217 comments)
30. Build a Database in Four Months with Rust and 647 Open-Source Dependencies (112 points | 110 comments)
